thread.title: WeissLaw LLP: Gramercy Property Trust Acquisition May Not Be In The Best Interests of GPT Shareholders

author: cnbc.com
title: WeissLaw LLP: Gramercy Property Trust Acquisition May Not Be In The Best Interests of GPT Shareholders

organizations.name: board of directors of gramercy property trust

text:
NEW YORK, May 7, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- WeissLaw LLP is investigating possible breaches of fiduciary duty and other violations of law by the Board of Directors of Gramercy Property Trust ("GPT" or the "Company") (NYSE: GPT) in connection with the proposed acquisition of the Company by affiliates of Blackstone Real Estate Partners VIII (the "Affiliates"). Under the terms of the acquisition agreement GPT shareholders will receive $27.50 in cash for each share they own.
WeissLaw is investigating whether GPT's Board acted to maximize shareholder value prior to entering into the agreement. Notably, at least one analyst set a target price of $33.00 per share, or $5.50 above the offer price. Additionally, in its latest financial release, the Company recognized total revenues of approximately $149.5 million, reflecting an annual increase of 15% when compared to the figures reported in the period of the previous year.
Given these facts, WeissLaw is investigating whether GPT's Board acted in the best interests of GPT's public shareholders to maximize shareholder value prior to entering into the agreement.
